spiffyhud.aggression_level.desc:
How aggressive the eraser should try to remove HUD elements.

§l- Normal:§r The eraser will not erase elements added via SpiffyHUD.
§l- Aggressive:§r The eraser will remove both Vanilla and SpiffyHUD elements.

Use §lAggressive§r if the normal level does not remove the target HUD element.
spiffyhud.edit_hud.desc:
Customize In-Game HUD

This button is bound to FancyMenu's menu bar.
You can hide it by hiding the menu bar.
spiffyhud.elements.chat_customizer.corne: In which screen corner the chat should get rendered.
spiffyhud.elements.chat_customizer.desc: Allows you to customize some parts of the chat.
spiffyhud.elements.chat_customizer.input: Set Custom Input Field Background Color [HEX]
spiffyhud.elements.dummy.display.cant_mo:
You can't move Vanilla HUD elements!
Delete the Vanilla element and add a Vanilla-like custom one instead!
spiffyhud.elements.dummy.subtitle: Subtitle
spiffyhud.elements.dummy.title: Title
spiffyhud.elements.hud_eraser.desc:
The eraser makes it possible to erase parts of the default HUD without needing to hide a HUD element.

This is especially useful if you want to remove HUD elements added by other mods that Spiffy can't customize/hide.

You need to FULLY COVER the area the HUD element gets rendered to hide it! Elements that are not 100%% covered by the eraser will NOT get removed.
spiffyhud.elements.overlay_remover.desc: Lets you remove different types of HUD overlays, like the pumpkin overlay, powder snow overlay or the vignette.
spiffyhud.elements.overlay_remover.overl: Sets the overlay type the element should remove.
spiffyhud.elements.player.desc: Mirrors the client player like in the Inventory screen.
spiffyhud.elements.player_air_bubble_bar: Sets the pixel distance between bubbles that share the same row.

Tracks the player's breath as rows of customizable air bubbles.
Supports alignment controls, auto sizing, scaling, per-slot popping animations
and optional low-air shaking with user supplied textures.
Sets how long a lost bubble stays in its popping state before becoming empty.

Applies a multiplier to the base 8x8 bubble size (e.g. 0.5, 1.0, 2.0).
Accepts placeholders that resolve to numeric values.
Makes bubbles jiggle randomly once the player's air is at or below the configured threshold.

Set custom textures for each bubble state. Leave empty to use the built-in colored rectangles.

Textures should be 8x8 pixels or any exact multiple of that size.
Sets the color of the overall compass backdrop. Accepts HEX codes (e.g. #AAF0F0F0) or placeholder values.
Controls the solid fill behind the grade lines. Accepts HEX codes and placeholders.
Controls the highlight color for the last-death indicator line. Accepts HEX codes and placeholders.
Sets the color of the compass needle. Accepts HEX codes and placeholders.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.desc: Draws a horizontal RPG-style compass that fills the element bounds.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.textur: Death Pointer Texture
Overrides the death pointer marker with a custom image. Leave empty to use the colored bar.
Needle Texture
Overrides the center needle with a custom image. Leave empty to use the colored bar.
spiffyhud.elements.player_food_bar.desc:
Displays the player's hunger as rows of fully customizable food icons.
Supports alignment controls, auto sizing, scaling, blinking when food is lost
and optional low-food shaking with per-state custom textures.
spiffyhud.elements.player_food_bar.icon_: Sets the pixel distance between food icons that share the same row.
spiffyhud.elements.player_food_bar.scale:
Applies a multiplier to the base 8x8 icon size (e.g. 0.5, 1.0, 2.0).
Accepts placeholders that resolve to numeric values.
spiffyhud.elements.player_food_bar.shake: Makes food icons jiggle randomly once the player's food level is at or below the configured threshold.
spiffyhud.elements.player_food_bar.textu:
Set custom textures for each food state. Leave empty to use the built-in colored rectangles.

Textures should be 8x8 pixels or any exact multiple of that size.
spiffyhud.elements.player_heart_health_b:
Renders the player's health as rows of hearts with fully customizable textures, spacing, scale and alignment.
Supports absorption hearts, damage states, low-health shaking and optional blink feedback when a heart is lost.
Sets the pixel distance between hearts that share the same row.

Applies a multiplier to the base 8x8 heart size (e.g. 0.5, 1.0, 2.0).
Accepts placeholders that resolve to numeric values.
Makes hearts jiggle randomly once the player's health is at or below the configured threshold.

Set custom textures for each heart state. Leave empty to use the built-in colored rectangles.

Textures should be 8x8 pixels or any exact multiple of that size.
spiffyhud.elements.player_mount_health_b:
Displays the health of the entity you are currently riding with customizable heart rows, scaling, spacing and textures.
Falls back to empty hearts while no mount is ridden so layouts never shift.
Sets the pixel distance between hearts that share the same row.

Applies a multiplier to the base 8x8 heart size (e.g. 0.5, 1.0, 2.0).
Accepts placeholders that resolve to numeric values.
Makes mount hearts jiggle randomly once the mount's health is at or below the configured threshold.

Set custom textures for each heart state. Leave empty to use the built-in colored rectangles.

Textures should be 8x8 pixels or any exact multiple of that size.
spiffyhud.elements.player_nbt_helper.des:
This element doesn't do anything really.
It's just a lazy way to implement something that lets you see all NBT data paths of the client player, to use them for the "Player NBT Data" placeholder.
spiffyhud.elements.player_nbt_helper.pat: List With ALL Player NBT Data Paths
spiffyhud.elements.single_line_text.desc:
A simple single-line text that supports
Minecraft's JSON component text system.
That's the system used for the /tellraw command, so you can simply use a /tellraw online generator to generate text that should get displayed.
spiffyhud.elements.single_line_text.scal:
Sets the multiplier that gets applied to the text size as float value (e.g.: 0.5, 1.0, 2.0, etc.).
Supports placeholders that resolve to numbers.
spiffyhud.elements.slot.desc: Displays the item in the given inventory slot or the selected hotbar slot item.
spiffyhud.elements.slot.slot_id_help.tex:
^^^

# Important Slot IDs for the Player Inventory
 
 
## Hotbar

 - **Slot IDs:** 0 to 8
 - The first hotbar slot is 0.

## Main Inventory

  - **Slot IDs:** 9 to 35
  - The top-left main inventory slot is 9.

## Armor Slots

  - **Slot IDs:** 36 to 39
  - 36 (boots), 37 (leggings), 38 (chestplate), 39 (helmet)

## Offhand Slot

  - **Slot ID:** 40
 
 
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Keksuccino/Spiffy-HUD/refs/heads/main/mod_resources/inv_slots_1.20.1_small.png)

^^^
spiffyhud.placeholders.action_bar_messag:
Gets the current action bar message (the text above the hotbar).
Returns an empty text when no action bar message is displayed.
The time left in ticks that the original Vanilla action bar message gets displayed.
spiffyhud.placeholders.camera_rotation_d:
Displays the raw change in camera pitch (X axis) between ticks as a decimal value.
The value may be positive or negative.

Displays the raw change in camera yaw (Y axis) between ticks as a decimal value.
The value may be positive or negative.
spiffyhud.placeholders.camera_rotation_x: Returns the camera X rotation as value between -180.0 and 180.0 (degrees).
spiffyhud.placeholders.camera_rotation_y: Returns the camera Y rotation as value between -180.0 and 180.0 (degrees).
spiffyhud.placeholders.highlighted_item_: The time left in ticks that the original Vanilla highlighted item's name gets displayed above the hotbar.
spiffyhud.placeholders.player_item_use_p:
Returns the current item use progress of the player.
This is, for example, the progress of eating food, drinking a potion, drawing a bow, etc.
The returned value is a decimal between 0.0 (0%) and 1.0 (100%).
spiffyhud.placeholders.player_nbt_data.d:
Gets an NBT data value from the player.
Uses NBT data paths to get the value.
To see a list of all NBT data paths, please add an "Player NBT Helper" element to your layout.
spiffyhud.placeholders.player_position_d:
Displays the change in player position along the X axis between ticks as a decimal value.
The value can be positive or negative.

Displays the change in player position along the Y axis between ticks as a decimal value.
The value can be positive or negative.

Displays the change in player position along the Z axis between ticks as a decimal value.
The value can be positive or negative.
spiffyhud.placeholders.slot_item_display:
Gets the display name of an item in a specific slot.
Setting 'ignore_spectator' to 'true' will ignore Spectator GUI slots in Spectator mode.
spiffyhud.requirements.is_player_in_stru:
Checks if the player is currently in a specific structure type.
§xSpiffy needs to be installed on the server for this to work!
spiffyhud.requirements.is_player_using_i:
Returns true when the player is using an item.
Using an item means, for example, eating food, drinking a potion, drawing a bow, etc.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.hostil: Displays nearby monsters as red dots along the lower edge of the compass.
Draws the actual mob model instead of a dot. Overrides custom textures when enabled.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.passiv: Displays nearby neutral, passive, or ambient mobs as yellow dots along the lower edge of the compass.
Draws the actual model instead of a dot. Overrides custom textures when enabled.
Sets the fallback color for hostile mob dots when no texture is selected.
Sets the fallback color for non-hostile mob dots when no texture is selected.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.textur: Hostile Mob Dot Texture
Optional image that replaces the default hostile mob dot. Best results use even square textures (2x2, 4x4, …) but any image works; it renders at the dot's size without preserving aspect ratio.
Other Mob Dot Texture

Optional image that replaces the default dot for non-hostile mobs. Best results use even square textures (2x2, 4x4, …) but any image works; it renders at the dot's size without preserving aspect ratio.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.hostil: Sets how many blocks around the player get scanned for hostile mobs.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.passiv: Sets how many blocks around the player get scanned for non-hostile mobs.
spiffyhud.actions.add_marker.desc:
Adds a persistent marker to the marker storage of the targeted element.
Markers are used for Compass and Minimap elements.
spiffyhud.actions.edit_marker.desc: Updates an existing marker of the target element. Use this to change its name, visuals, or coordinates without re-adding it.
spiffyhud.actions.remove_marker.desc: Removes a marker entry from the target element's marker storage.
Identifier of the element whose marker group should be modified. This usually matches the element identifier displayed in FancyMenu's editor.
spiffyhud.actions.marker.lookup_name.des: Name of the existing marker that should be edited. Leave blank to reuse the Display Name as the lookup key.
spiffyhud.actions.marker.display_name.de: Unique name of the marker. Supports spaces and uppercase characters and appears inside UI elements.
spiffyhud.actions.marker.color.desc:
HEX color that renders when no texture is set.
Examples: #FFAA00 or #FFAA00CC (RGBA).
Enable to render the marker as a needle on compasses. Disable to show it as a dot.
spiffyhud.actions.marker.position_x.desc: World X coordinate (blocks) for the marker's position. Accepts decimal precision.
spiffyhud.actions.marker.position_z.desc: World Z coordinate (blocks) for the marker's position. Accepts decimal precision.
spiffyhud.actions.marker.remove_name.des: Exact display name of the marker entry that should be deleted from the selected element.
spiffyhud.actions.marker.dot_texture.des: Optional texture that renders when the marker is shown as a dot. Accepts FancyMenu resource identifiers or absolute paths and falls back to the needle texture (or marker color) if unset.
spiffyhud.actions.marker.dot_texture.pic: Open the FancyMenu resource picker to select an image for dot markers.
spiffyhud.actions.marker.dot_texture.cle: Remove the dot texture so the marker uses the fallback color instead.
Optional texture that renders when the marker is shown as a needle. Accepts FancyMenu resource identifiers or absolute paths and falls back to the dot texture or color if unset.
Open the FancyMenu resource picker to select an image for needle markers.
Remove the needle texture so the marker uses the fallback color (or dot texture) instead.
spiffyhud.placeholders.marker_list.desc:
Returns every marker display name stored for the provided target element identifier.
Use the 'separator' value to control how the names are joined.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.world_: Toggles rendering of stored world markers on this compass while keeping the marker data accessible for actions.
Deletes every stored world marker tied to this element identifier. This action cannot be undone.

Remove all world markers for this compass?

This §xpermanently deletes§r all markers of this compass. You can re-create markers later with actions.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.textur: Compass Bar Texture

Optional image that replaces the bar fill. The texture slides as the compass rotates and seamlessly wraps, so repeatable stripe or gradient textures work best. Leave empty to keep the solid color fill.
Major Tick Texture
Overrides the tall major tick marks with an image that stretches to the compass height while keeping its aspect ratio. The texture stays centered on each major tick.
Minor Tick Texture
Overrides the smaller tick marks with a texture that fills the compass height and remains centered on the tick position. Leave empty to keep the color line.
Sets the color used for the long ticks that anchor the N/E/S/W letters when no texture is provided.
Sets the fallback color for the remaining major tick marks (30°, 60°, etc.) when no texture overrides them.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.textur: Cardinal Tick Texture
Overrides the long tick lines behind the cardinal letters with an image that scales to the compass height while maintaining aspect ratio. The texture stays centered on each cardinal tick.
Degree Tick Texture
Overrides the remaining major tick marks (30°, 60°, etc.) with an image that fills the compass height and stays centered on the tick position.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.hostil: Multiplier that resizes hostile mob dots. Needs decimal numbers. Supports placeholders. Values below 1.0 shrink the dots and values above 1.0 enlarge them.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.passiv: Multiplier that resizes "other" mob dots. Needs decimal numbers. Supports placeholders. Values below 1.0 shrink the dots and values above 1.0 enlarge them.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.marker: Multiplier that resizes world markers. Needs decimal numbers. Supports placeholders. Values below 1.0 shrink the dots and values above 1.0 enlarge them.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.cardin: Offsets the long tick lines that align with N/E/S/W. Accepts placeholders so you can animate the entire cardinal track.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.degree: Offsets the degree tick lines vertically. Supports placeholders.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.minor_: Offsets the smaller in-between tick lines vertically. Supports placeholders.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.cardin: Offsets the N/E/S/W labels vertically. Supports placeholders.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.degree: Offsets the number row position vertically. Supports placeholders.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.needle: Moves the main compass needle up or down. Applies to both textures and the fallback color strip.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.marker: Offsets world marker dots/needles vertically. Supports placeholders for dynamic binding.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.death_: Shifts the death pointer needle up or down. Placeholders allowed for animations.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.cardin: Multiplier applied to the N/E/S/W text size. Accepts decimals and placeholders so you can grow or shrink the letters dynamically.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.degree: Multiplier that resizes the degree numbers row. Works with placeholders for animated scaling.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.hostil: Adds a base vertical shift to hostile mob dots before the distance-based movement is applied. Accepts placeholders.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.passiv: Offsets other mob dots up or down while keeping their near/far animation intact. Supports placeholders.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.mob_do: When enabled, mob dots shift vertically to visualize how near each mob is. Disable this to lock every mob dot to the marker height while still applying the mob dot Y-Offset.
spiffyhud.elements.player_compass.textur: North Cardinal Texture
Replaces the "N" letter with a texture. The image keeps its aspect ratio and follows the cardinal letter scale.
East Cardinal Texture
Replaces the "E" letter with a texture that scales alongside the cardinal letter size without stretching.
South Cardinal Texture
Replaces the "S" letter with a texture. The texture respects its aspect ratio and the configured cardinal letter scale.
West Cardinal Texture
Replaces the "W" letter with a texture that is centered on the tick, keeps its aspect ratio, and honors the cardinal letter scale.
